main event: On December 14, 1962, a witness observed a bright flash in the sky which appeared to be an object moving through the air, possibly caused by a meteor.
interesting points: The object appeared to be two objects converging into one., The observation lasted for 2 seconds., It was noted that the object's intensity decreased after the flash., The sighting involved a single object and was categorized under ground-visual observation., Dr. J. Allen Hynek, an astronomer, suggested the sighting was likely an astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: a bright flash in the sky
witness description: The witness observed a flash in the sky and described the object as potentially being a meteor.
